alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Comanche; Grady; Stephens (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 12 at 6:24AM CDT until June 12 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Comanche County in southwestern Oklahoma... Southwestern Grady County in central Oklahoma... Southern Caddo County in southwestern Oklahoma... Northwestern Stephens County in southern Oklahoma... * Until 715 AM CDT. * At 624 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fort Cobb to near Lake Lawtonka, moving east- southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Duncan, Anadarko, Marlow, Elgin, Apache, Rush Springs, Fletcher, Cyril, Sterling, Fort Cobb, Cement, Medicine Park, Norge, Lake Lawtonka, Agawam, Boone, Lake Ellsworth, eastern Fort Sill, Central High, and Ninnekah. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
